result.execSummary:
The defendant Houa Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation review hearing October 7, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 21.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept. of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED or HSED.

- No contact with firearms.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.

- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- AODA and recommended treatment.  Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending a review on 6/10/16 at 1:130 pm in Branch 45.
*6/10/2016 Stay lifted as to 30 days.  Straight time. Forthwith. Order for Commitment for Condition time signed.
**02-24-17/PRH - Defendant is non-compliance with probation conditions and is ordered to serve 30 days STRAIGHT TIME; beginning on 01-30-17.

Defendant Houa Vang in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant  with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed. 
Request for potential early termination of probation, DENIED.

Defendant Houa Vang in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj

Defendant Houa Vang in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  All parties are notified that effective 08-01-16 this case will be assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21, in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served.   The Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 60days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 6/10/16 at 1:130 pm in Branch 45.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
- AODA and recommended treatment/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept. of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at $0.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Houa Vang in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case recalled.  Case calendared for jury trial.  State placed negotiations on the record.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Houa Vang in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for jury trial.  First call.  State is ready to proceed to jury trial.  Defense requests time to reach possible DPA resolution.  Court ordered case passed.

Defendant Houa Vang in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 45 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 3-09-2016.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Positive drug test with valid prescription.  No action taken by the court at this time.

Defendant Houa Vang in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference held between counsel.  Defense needs discovery.  Parties request this matter be scheduled for Jury Trial and Final Pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not present when case first called but later appeared and was admonished to be on time.
Atty Plaisted was contacted by the clerk to pick a new date of 12-21-2015 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or any dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Yee V., S.V. (DOB 5/30/94).  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. State informs the court that there may be new charges against the defendant. Case passed to investigate possible new case.
